sen.j: 聞香札（もんこうふだ）は、香道において使用する札のこと。
sen.e: Monko-fuda is a card used in kodo (traditional incense-smelling ceremony).
Monko-fuda are cards used in Kodo (the Japanese art of appreciating incense, and involves using incense within a structure of codified conducte).

sen.cmt: Kodoの定義の用語を統一しました。

sen.j: 香道では香の香りを嗅ぐことを「聞く」、聞香と表現する。
sen.e: In kodo, sniffing the incense is expressed as "listening," therefore Chinese characters "聞香" (listening to the incense) are applied to "monko."
In kodo, the sniffing of the incense is expressed as "listening" to the incense, and as such, it is called monko (in kanji, 聞香 (lit. listening to the incense)).

sen.e: The word "monko" implicates tasting the smell leisurely in mind, not sniffing the smell.
The term "monko" implies tasting the scent within your mind, and not simply sniffing the scent.

sen.e: Similarly, if participant guesses it is the second-numbered incense, he or she puts a monko-fuda with a figure of two, and if participant guesses it is the third-numbered incense, he or she puts a monko-fuda with a figure of three.
